fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: The Ukrainian Think Tanks Liaison Office follows any EU policies and initiatives that concern Ukraine and the relevant geographical area, with an emphasis on: Neighborhood Policy, Foreign Policy (with a particular focus on EU-Ukraine, EU-Russia and EU-US relations), EU Association Agreements, Eastern Partnership, DCFTAs, Trade Policy with third countries, Energy Union, Transatlantic relations.
organisation_name: Ukrainian Think Tanks Liaison Office in Brussels (UTTLOB)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
The Ukrainian Think Tanks Liaison Office organises events in partnership with Brussels-based think tanks to present publications of the Ukrainian expert community.  
 
The aim of these conferences is to provide all stakeholders in Brussels with on-the-ground information on the state of reforms implementation in Ukraine in line with the EU-Ukraine Association Agreement, and give recommendations to EU decision-makers on how to better drive this process forward.
goals__remit:
The Ukrainian Think Tanks Liaison Office in Brussels is a non-profit organisation that unites leading Ukrainian and EU think tanks, whose unique mission is to advance Ukraine’s reforms and its European integration. 
 
Our mission is to communicate internationally the knowledge and opinion of the Ukrainian expert community. We  provide a non-partisan platform to deal with EU-Ukraine critical issues and is establishing a network of researchers and policy-makers across Europe in order to achieve a lasting impact on Ukraine’s democratic development and European integration. We envisage Ukraine as a reformed country and a member of the EU, and we endeavor to achieve this goal.
